required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Evolocumab in Ischemic Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of Evolocumab in in Combination With Statin Therapy in Adults With Ischemic Stroke

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangxi Medical University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangxi Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this clinical trial is to evaluate the effect of evolocumab in combination with statin therapy (atorvastatin) in acute ischemic stroke (AIS).

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks after treatment

secondary_outcome.description: incidence of Transient ischemic attack, stroke or other vascular events

arm_group.description: Patients with AIS are treated with atorvastatin (40mg) daily and evolocumab (420 mg) every months throughout the study period
Patients with AIS are treated with atorvastatin (40mg) daily throughout the study period.

intervention.description: Patients were randomly assigned of the ratio of 1:1 using a computer-generated random number and divided into two treatment groups: the statin alone therapy and the evolocumab plus statin therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patient age between 18-80 years
2. Time of onset: within 1 week
3. NIHSS score ≤12
4. Acute ischemic stroke confirmed by head CT or MRI
5. Premorbid mRS ≤1
6. Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Intracranial hemorrhage found by head CT
2. Severe hepatic or renal dysfunction
3. Pregnant females
4. Abnormal elevation of creatine phosphokinase
5. Blood sugar is out of control
6. Receiving statins within 1 month before onset
7. Not willing and able to comply with scheduled visits, lifestyle guidelines, treatment plan, laboratory tests, and other study procedures
8. Unsuitable for this clinical studies assessed by researcher

overall_official.affiliation: The Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangxi Medical University, Nanning, China

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangxi Medical University
